question: Question_01_(d)
statement:
\textbf{Short-Answer Question.} Show all your work, simplify your answer
as much as possible.

Let \emph{k} be a positive constant. Find the average value of the
function $f(x) = \sin(kx)$ on the interval $[0,\pi/k]$
sols:
Using the hint, we have

\begin{align*}
f_{av} &= \frac{1}{\pi/k-0}\int_{0}^{\pi/k}\sin(kx)\, dx\\
&= \frac{k}{\pi}\left.\left(\frac{-1}{k}\cos(kx) \right)\right|_{0}^{\pi/k}\\
&= \frac{-1}{\pi}\left( \cos(\pi) - \cos(0) \right)\\
&= \frac{-1}{\pi}( -1 -1)\\
&= \frac{2}{\pi}\end{align*}
hints:
The average value for a function $f(x)$ is defined by

\begin{align*}f_{av} = \frac{1}{b-a}\int_{a}^{b}f(x)\, dx\end{align*}
